issues.title: Cannot publish repo with long commit log?
issues.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. clone http://github.com/komeiji-satori/Dress (this repo has 846 commits)
2. create a new repo on git center
3. set the new repo as a remote of the cloned repo
4. force push the master branch
5. from the git center repo GUI, press 'Sign & Publish changes', crash
6. from the git center repo GUI, press 'Log', crash

issue_comments.body: I did allow more space from the HelloZero page (set limit to 2 GB)
Just tried to push it as another branch, then no problem when publish, but still cannot see the files and log from the web UI.
It seems the UI is not scalable to display relative large amount of content?

I noticed the CPU usage of the python process goes to 100% when viewing the UI of the mirrored branch, but no issue with a new branch with only one commit and 4 files.

## Examples

no problem on the master branch:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1Dressx5G2Cew5gTSUWRvNSDe2Q2GRs49D

100% CPU usage on the original master branch from the upstream:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1Dressx5G2Cew5gTSUWRvNSDe2Q2GRs49D/@mirror
